name: Master Degree in Theoretical Physics
description:
Thesis:
- Explored the demand for precise predictions in new physics models, addressing the complexities of analyzing and studying these phenomena in the field of phenomenology.
- Introduced and applied essential computer tools—FeynCalc, FeynArts, and FormCalc—to recalculate amplitudes of established processes in the Standard Model, providing insights into quantum field theory.
- Successfully defended the thesis in French, highlighting the pivotal role of these computational tools in advancing our comprehension of fundamental physical phenomena.
